I believe these are merely warnings and do not affect crawling.

(My guess is that these messages arise when you specify seeds inside 
crawler-beans.cxml; if there were a separate seeds.txt then heritrix 
would add these redirects to that file.)

Noah


parseram34 wrote:
> How would you crawl Facebook using Heritrix-3.1.1-SNAPSHOT on Ubuntu?
> I tried a page but it gives me the following error:
> 2010-03-19T09:40:47.928Z WARNING nowhere to log added seed: http://www.facebook.com/login.php?_fb_noscript=1 (in thread 'ToeThread #5: http://www.facebook.com/login.php'; in processor 'candidates')
>
> 2010-03-19T09:40:44.192Z WARNING nowhere to log added seed: http://www.facebook.com/login.php (in thread 'ToeThread #6: http://www.facebook.com/home.php'; in processor 'candidates')
